meanings.definition: To make international in character or scope.
meanings.sent1: Our company internationalises its products by selling them in different countries.
meanings.sent2: The organization internationalises its operations to reach a global audience.
meanings.sent3: The chef internationalises the menu by adding dishes from around the world.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for travel internationalises her perspective on life.
meanings.sent5: The internet internationalises communication, connecting people worldwide.

meanings.definition: To extend to or involve other countries or nations.
meanings.sent1: The treaty internationalises trade agreements between nations.
meanings.sent2: The charity internationalises its efforts to help communities in need globally.
meanings.sent3: The virus internationalises its spread, affecting multiple countries.
meanings.sent4: His music internationalises cultural influences, blending sounds from different nations.
meanings.sent5: The company internationalises its reach, expanding its services to international markets.
